column1: Woodmere is a village in Cuyahoga County and an eastern suburb of the Greater Cleveland  area in the US state of Ohio. As of the 2010 census
column2: Woodmere had a population of 884 residents. The village is bounded on the north by the city of Pepper Pike
column3: on the west by the city of Beachwood
column4: and on the south and east by the village of Orange.

column1: Woodmere is one of the five municipalities
column6: the birthplace of President James A. Garfield. While the other four municipalities were established in the 1920s
column7: Woodmere was incorporated as a village in 1944. Today
column9: Woodmere serves as the primary commercial district for all parts of the original Orange Township.
